extendedInfo.description: Color Reference is a tool for designers and web developers, similar to kuler.Get inspiration for your designs and discover new colors schemas.Browse RGB colors list with color namesCreate and save new RGB colorsCheck harmonic and complementary coloresBrowse color palettesCreate your owns palettes up to 5 colorsImprove your CSS designs with the HTML and RGB codes.Compatible with tablets

reviews.title: Ok app
reviews.comment: The app would be amazing if only I was able to actually set the colors as my background.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Does not work
reviews.comment: Crashes on Nook HD+. Cannot use if it cannot work.
reviews.author: Stephen Mindykowski

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Lightweight and easy to use. Great for thinking about new color schemes for websites. Also great to check color diferences on mobile and hd computer screen. Great!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Improve!
reviews.comment: Good app, but the UI use some refinery. Also it would be nice to create palettes automagically by certain rules and have your current colors as a reference in the screen when adding new ones.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Horrible UI
reviews.comment: It looks and functions like a 2008 app. So ugly I can\'t use it without suffering PTSD afterwards.
reviews.author: Flavio Zanda

reviews.title: Fine. Needs work.
reviews.comment: Please add a feature to set my colors as background!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.comment: An excellent free substitute for Kuler. I suspect that those who say the app doesn\'t work right aren\'t using it correctly. And as far as setting your palette as a desktop background, that\'s not really what this app is for.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It could be better
reviews.comment: If you have in mind kuler... You going to be disappointed
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Odd
reviews.comment: Not entirly sure how I\'d use this sucker but who knows, Ijust might.
reviews.author: Skyler Madison

reviews.title: Terrible- no instructions
reviews.comment: No good- I\'ve been working with this trying to build a custom palette but there seems to be no way to actually add the selected colors to the palette. Waste of time.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very good...
reviews.comment: ...to find the complementary colour of a colour. A must have for me.
reviews.author: Alex Persa
